shared.facades

Class TradingFacade

  • java.lang.Object
    • shared.facades.AbstractFacade
      • shared.facades.TradingFacade

  • public class TradingFacade
extends AbstractFacade
    Provides common operations for users to trade with each other.

    • Method Detail

      • canOfferTrade

        public boolean canOfferTrade(@NotNull
                             Player sender,
                             @NotNull
                             Player receiver,
                             @NotNull
                             ResourceList offer)
        Returns whether a player can trade with another player with the given conditions.

        These are the conditions to be met:

        • sender and receiver must be in the same game.
        • It must be sender's turn.
        • The game must be in a state in which trading is allowed.
        • The offer must add and subtract at least one resource.
        Parameters:
        sender - the sender of the trade, not null
        receiver - the receiver of the trade, not null
        offer - the offer to make - what sender gets (+) and receives (-)
        Returns:
        true if all of the conditions are met; otherwise false
        See Also:
        canOfferTrade(Player, Player)
        Precondition:
        None of the parameters are null.

      • canOfferTrade

        public boolean canOfferTrade(@NotNull
                             Player sender,
                             @NotNull
                             Player receiver)
        Returns whether a player can trade with another player at all.

        These are the conditions to be met:

        • sender and receiver must be in the same game.
        • It must be sender's turn.
        • The game must be in a state in which trading is allowed.
        Parameters:
        sender - the sender of the trade, not null
        receiver - the receiver of the trade, not null
        Returns:
        true if all of the conditions are met; otherwise false
        See Also:
        canOfferTrade(Player, Player, ResourceList)
        Precondition:
        None of the parameters are null.

      • offerTrade

        public void offerTrade(@NotNull
                       Player sender,
                       @NotNull
                       Player receiver,
                       @NotNull
                       ResourceList offer)
        Offer to trade with another player with the given conditions.

        Note that this only modifies the local model. The server must be called as well.

        Parameters:
        sender - the sender of the trade, not null
        receiver - the receiver of the trade, not null
        offer - the offer to make - what sender gets (+) and receives (-)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the precondition is violated
        See Also:
        canOfferTrade(Player, Player, ResourceList), ServerProxy.offerTrade(OfferTradeAction)
        Precondition:
        canOfferTrade(Player, Player, ResourceList) returns true
        Postcondition:
        A pending trade offer will be pending for the sender and receiver.

      • maritimeTradeRatio

        public int maritimeTradeRatio(@NotNull
                              Player player,
                              @NotNull
                              ResourceType resourceType)
        Get the best maritime trade ratio available to a player.

        For example, a trade ratio of 3 for ore means that the player can trade 3 ore for any resource card.

        Depending on the player's harbor configuration, this returns 2-4.

        Parameters:
        player - the player to check for, not null
        resourceType - the type of resource to check, not null
        Returns:
        the best trade ratio available to the player for the given resource type, 2-4

      • canMaritimeTrade

        public boolean canMaritimeTrade(@NotNull
                                Player player,
                                @NotNull
                                ResourceType inputResource,
                                @NotNull
                                ResourceType outputResource)
        Determines whether a player can perform a maritime trade with the given resource.

        It must be the player's turn, and at the ratio desired must be valid.

        Parameters:
        player - the player that wants to perform the trade, not null
        inputResource - the type of resource to trade with, not null
        outputResource - the type of resource to trade for, not null
        Returns:
        true if the player can maritime trade with these conditions; false otherwise
        Precondition:
        ratio is equal to the value returned by maritimeTradeRatio(shared.models.game.Player, shared.definitions.ResourceType)
        Postcondition:
        None.

      • maritimeTrade

        public void maritimeTrade(@NotNull
                          Player player,
                          @NotNull
                          ResourceType inputResource,
                          @NotNull
                          ResourceType outputResource)
        Performs a maritime trade with the given resource and ratio.

        It must be the player's turn, and at the ratio desired must be valid.

        Parameters:
        player - the player that wants to perform the trade, not null
        inputResource - the type of resource to trade with, not null
        outputResource - the type of resource to trade for, not null
        Precondition:
        canMaritimeTrade(shared.models.game.Player, shared.definitions.ResourceType, shared.definitions.ResourceType) returns true.
        Postcondition:
        the user trades ratio of the resourceType for 1
